728301f-a.title: Richmond: Amboy Road - Great Kills Road
728301f-a.text:
3879 Amboy Road, north side, between Great Kills Road and
Giffords Lane, showing ''Romeo's Famous Old Gifford Inn.' It was
formerly known as the Wedemeyer Hotel (1917) and prior to that, the
''O1d Gifford Inn'' (1907). In 1898 it was the home of J.W. Hetherington.
Beers' 1874 map refers to it as the Gifford Rouse, then occupied by
G. Eent.
May 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
728301f-a.folder: Amboy Road & Great Kills Road, Staten Island, NY

728299f-a.title: Richmond: Amboy Road - Great Kills Road
728299f-a.text:
3833 Amboy Road, at the N.W. corner of Great Eills Road. This
house was occupied by Charles Walter Jr. (1907) and earlier (1898)
by Cole. It was the A. Sharrott home in 1874. The dates refer to
Hiaps on which the owners' names appear.
May 17, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
728299f-a.folder: Amboy Road & Great Kills Road, Staten Island, NY

728300f-a.title: Richmond: Amboy Road - Great Kills Road
728300f-a.text:
3841 Acboy Road, west of the N.W. corner of
Great Kills Road. This house belonged to M.R. and S.A.
Lewis (1907), to Mary E. Lewis (1898), and to J. Lewis
(1874). The dates refer to maps on which the owners'
names appear.
May 17,1932
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
